items.title: U.S. News Rankings Are Out After a Tumultuous Year for Colleges
items.summary: But despite it all, very little changed on the lists many parents and prospective students turn to as admissions season kicks off.

items.title: Mamdani Lands Endorsement From Kamala Harris, His Biggest Yet
items.summary: “I support the Democrat in the race,” Ms. Harris said during an interview with Rachel Maddow. She added of the Democratic Party, “we’ve got a big tent and we’ve got a lot of stars.”

items.title: For Trump, Who Has ‘Strong Feelings’ About Autism, the Issue Is Personal
items.summary: The president delivered impassioned — if scientifically dubious — remarks about what he described as one of “the most alarming public health developments in history.”

items.title: Trump Signs Order Targeting Antifa Movement
items.summary: President Trump’s executive order threatened to prosecute donors who support antifascist philosophy and issued a domestic terrorism designation that doesn’t exist under U.S. law.

items.title: ‘I Hate My Opponent’: Trump’s Remarks at Kirk Memorial Distill His Politics
items.summary: President Trump has been fueled by grievance and animosity over the course of his political and public life.

items.title: Halligan, Trump’s Chosen Prosecutor, Takes Over Comey and James Cases
items.summary: The president is pushing up against the statute of limitations in his pursuit of charges against a former F.B.I. director, and also wants the attorney general of New York and a California senator prosecuted.

items.title: Donald Trump signs order designating antifa as a domestic terror organization – as it happened
items.summary: <p>This blog has closed. Read our latest story <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/22/trump-executive-order-antifa-terrorist-organization">here</a></p><p>Per my last post, it’s important to underscore that <strong>autism has been a focus for Kennedy</strong>. Earlier this month, the Wall Street Journal <a href="https://www.wsj.com/health/healthcare/rfk-jr-hhs-to-link-autism-to-tylenol-use-in-pregnancy-and-folate-deficiencies-e3acbb4c?gaa_at=eafs&amp;gaa_n=ASWzDAhwJUrTkQQKbf3fCPdx7a164OXbN3bA3HHVYMK1BmPXirXKdNsVALYTST5ieD8%3D&amp;gaa_ts=68d146ed&amp;gaa_sig=1YrB1_HneQxFDdL6Iz82R1yFPTDUITrQ991UFvw7hlf3GcuaXlh6Tq2SIVnB6tq-dwU4LO2n-laPq65v0IBmQA%3D%3D">reported</a> that Kennedy planned to announce that use of Tylenol by pregnant women was potentially linked to <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/society/autism">autism</a> spectrum disorder. Kennedy has claimed that the US is in the grip of an “autism epidemic” fuelled by “environmental toxins”.</p><p>A reminder that the <strong>American </strong><strong>College of Obstetrics and Gynecology </strong>(ACOG) says there’s “no clear evidence” linking “prudent” use of acetaminophen to issues with fetal development.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/22/donald-trump-charlie-kirk-autism-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Experts alarmed as Trump pushes unproven link between Tylenol and autism
items.summary: <p>Doctors call president’s warning that pregnant women should limit use of acetaminophen – also known as paracetamol - ‘highly concerning’ and ‘irresponsible’</p><p>Medical experts are raising alarms after Donald Trump warned pregnant women to avoid taking Tylenol, baselessly linking the painkiller – also known as paracetamol - with a rise in autism among children.</p><p>From the Society for Maternal-Fetal Medicine (SMFM) to the <a href="https://www.facebook.com/ACOGNational/posts/acetaminophen-remains-a-safe-trusted-option-for-pain-relief-during-pregnancy-des/1180418200784501/">American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists</a> (ACOG<em>)</em>, doctors have endorsed the use of acetaminophen during pregnancy after <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/22/trump-administration-autism-causes">Trump said pregnant women who can’t “tough it out”</a> without the painkiller should limit their intake.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/22/trump-tylenol-experts-autism">Continue reading...</a>
